DataElement.preferredDefinition: A status to indicate whether the presence of actual or potential neoplastic tissue has been left outside the boundary of a resected specimen of the skin (cutaneous melanomas), other anatomic sites including the gastrointestinal system, eye, urinary tract, and reproductive system, or in metastasized lymph nodes, liver, lungs, and brain sites.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The determination of the presence of actual or potential neoplastic tissue which has been left outside the boundary of a resected specimen within the patient._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The determination of the presence of actual or potential neoplastic tissue which has been left outside the boundary of a resected specimen within the patient.

Concepts.definition: The determination of the presence of actual or potential neoplastic tissue which has been left outside the boundary of a resected specimen within the patient.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having determined the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
DataElementConcept.administrativeNotes: 9/8/23: Released  melanoma  AI per 3Q23 metric report review. LS

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A malignant, usually aggressive tumor composed of atypical, neoplastic melanocytes. Most often, melanomas arise in the skin (cutaneous melanomas) and include the following histologic subtypes: superficial spreading melanoma, nodular melanoma, acral lentiginous melanoma, and lentigo maligna melanoma. Cutaneous melanomas may arise from acquired or congenital melanocytic or dysplastic nevi. Melanomas may also arise in other anatomic sites including the gastrointestinal system, eye, urinary tract, and reproductive system. Melanomas frequently metastasize to lymph nodes, liver, lungs, and brain._A condition or state at a particular time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A result that the margin is involved by invasive melanoma.

Concepts.definition: A result that the margin is involved by invasive melanoma.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A result that the margin status cannot be assessed.

Concepts.definition: A result that the margin status cannot be assessed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A result that the margin is uninvolved by invasive melanoma.

Concepts.definition: A result that the margin is uninvolved by invasive melanoma.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
